description: Topics include basic cryptography, security protocols, access control, multilevel security, physical and environmental security, network security, application security, e-services security, human aspects and business continuity planning. Discusses applications which need various combinations of confidentiality, availability, integrity and covertness properties; mechanisms to incorporate and test these properties in systems. Policy and legal issues are also covered.
title: Security Engineering
preAndCorequisites:
• Complete all of the following
    • Complete all of:
      • SENG265 - Software Development Methods (1.5)
    • minimum third-year standing in the Software Engineering or Computer Engineering or Computer Science program.
